findings.title: Better error handling in case token is not complaint with registry
findings.description: In function _nextBigAmountToken, if this is the first bid, there is no check if the complaint token used is supported by the registry, resulting in division by zero and INVALID_OPCODE.

findings.title: Return Value of an External Call is never used Effectively
findings.description: The external calls made in the function return a boolean value indicating whether the call was successful or not. However, these returns are never used effectively to check if the further execution of the function should be allowed.

findings.title: Coding Style Issues in the Contract
findings.description: Code readability of a Smart Contract is largely influenced by the Coding Style issues and in some specific scenarios may lead to bugs in the future.

findings.title: NatSpec Annotations must be included
findings.description: The smart contracts do not include the NatSpec annotations adequately.
